title.narrative: Afghanistan (l'): Aide ciblée aux pays
Afghanistan: Targeted country assistance

description.narrative:
L’assistance technique est un soutien non financier fourni par des spécialistes. Elle peut revêtir plusieurs formes : partage d’information et de savoir-faire, formation et services-conseils.
L’assistance technique fournie dans le cadre du PEF est appelée aide ciblée aux pays. Ce type de soutien vise principalement à payer le personnel basé en permanence dans les bureaux pays des partenaires. Il repose sur la demande et les besoins identifiés par les pays eux-mêmes.

Technical assistance is non-financial support provided by specialists. It can take the form of sharing information and expertise, training and consulting services.
The technical assistance provided through PEF is called targeted country assistance (TCA). This type of support mainly consists of staff permanently based in partners’ country offices. It is based on the demand and needs identified by the countries themselves.

Cette activité détaille notre travail sur le Aide ciblée aux pays en Afghanistan (l'), grâce à la mise à disposition des données budgétaires et des transactions. Nous fournissons également les documents pertinents qui guident ces activités que sont les formulaires de demande de soutien fournis par le gouvernement de Afghanistan (l') ainsi que les lettres de décisions émises par Gavi, pour progresser. Ces documents décrivent les activités, les objectifs ainsi que les bénéficiaires.

This activity details our work on Targeted country assistance in Afghanistan through the provision of budget and transaction data. We also provide the relevant documents that guide these activities, which are the support request proposal(s) provided by the Government of Afghanistan, as well as the decision letter(s) issued by Gavi, for progress. These documents describe the activities, the objectives as well as the beneficiaries.

title.narrative: UNICEF : Leadership, management, and coordination (LMC)

? Final version of monthly datapacks for new regions ? Overview and success factors for activities and responsibilities to transfer to Government during Phase III ? Revised supervisor training materials ? Quarterly progress report

target.value: 1) Drive further improvements in performance in the 17 provinces in which the program is already live. 2) Expand the program across the remaining 17 provinces. 3) Launch a pilot to monitor outreach performance in three provinces. 4) Strengthen performance management by creating new ?meeting facilitation manuals?, and developing ?best practice? case studies on improvements delivered by managers. 5)Hardwire sustainability into the approach through progressively transferring responsibilities to NEPI teams, and through developing an ?LMC implementation manual? for EPI managers.

title.narrative: Plan to scale-up across 17 new provinces

target.value: 1) Drive further improvements in performance in the 17 provinces in which the program is already live. 2) Expand the program across the remaining 17 provinces. 3) Launch a pilot to monitor outreach performance in three provinces. 4) Strengthen performance management by creating new ?meeting facilitation manuals?, and developing ?best practice? case studies on improvements delivered by managers. 5)Hardwire sustainability into the approach through progressively transferring responsibilities to NEPI teams, and through developing an ?LMC implementation manual? for EPI managers.

title.narrative: WHO : Leadership, management, and coordination (LMC)
The annual plan of actions is approved

target.value: A / HSS National Program Officer to support coordination between HSS, RI program, MoPH line departments, BPHS/EPHS implementing NGOs, other partners, and donors, with a special focus on the following: - Contribute to the quarterly, semi-annual, and annual performance review of BPHS/EPHS implementers - Contribute to the Full Portfolio Planning and development of PSR - Contribute to EPI coverage survey - Contribute to AfDHS and facilitating the inclusion of immunization related indicators - Contribute to the introduction of COVID vaccine - Contribute to HSS/EPI related meetings, reviews, and workshops - Contribute to the development of new National Health Policy and Strategy and advocate for prioritizing immunization - Contribute to Polio transition planning

Assist in planning, budgeting, procurement, receving and distribution of lab reagents, specimen collection kits, consumable supplies, equipment, recording and reporting materials for VPD surveillance; procurement of different items for RI programs and distribution to the labs and 34 provinces; and supporing NIP in VPD surveillance data entering; perform admin and finance support.

In close coordination with NIP and BPHS NGOs to conduct need assessment for planning refresher training courses on RI and facilitate training sessions; plan and conduct trainin courses on accelerated immunization activities, assist NIP in training of staff on Measles SIAs, introduction of new vaccine; develop training materials on different aspects of RI including EVMA, EPI review, DQs, coverage survey and annual review of national immunization programs and conduct field monitoring

Provide technical and logistic support to MOPH by joint monthly and annual plan of actions for strenthening VPD surveillance system at all level of health system by planning/implementing training, supportive supervision, field monitoring, conducting monthly review of VPD surveillance and reporting to all partners

Provide administrative/finacial/technical support in planning, budgeting, managing, using of resources, controlling, accounting monitoring of correct using of fund and timely reporting to the relevant partners; facilitating EPI/VPD surveillance related training courses, workshops, EPI reviews, assessments, and monitoring of using funds at sub-national level.

title.narrative: Annual detailed plan of actions are available

target.value: A / HSS National Program Officer to support coordination between HSS, RI program, MoPH line departments, BPHS/EPHS implementing NGOs, other partners, and donors, with a special focus on the following: - Contribute to the quarterly, semi-annual, and annual performance review of BPHS/EPHS implementers - Contribute to the Full Portfolio Planning and development of PSR - Contribute to EPI coverage survey - Contribute to AfDHS and facilitating the inclusion of immunization related indicators - Contribute to the introduction of COVID vaccine - Contribute to HSS/EPI related meetings, reviews, and workshops - Contribute to the development of new National Health Policy and Strategy and advocate for prioritizing immunization - Contribute to Polio transition planning
